arts.ttl: Man City Player Ratings vs. Villarreal: Guardiola’s Stars Shine in Dominant Victory
arts.sum: The Cityzens remained unbeaten in the Champions League this season.

arts.ttl: Erling Haaland irresistible as Manchester City roll over Villarreal
arts.athr: Sid Lowe at Estadio de la Cerámica
arts.sum: Villarreal were Erling Haaland’s latest victims, a ninth consecutive Manchester City game clocked up with the Norwegian scoring. This time it was the first on the way to a largely comfortable 2-0 win in Spain that suggests that a team is emerging once again, with Bernardo Silva scoring the second in a first half of notable superiority before a second in which there were moments to suffer but not too many of them. When Haaland was withdrawn with five minutes to go, there were whistles and relief; he, and they, could do no more damage. He had already done enough, right from the start of what was a long night for the home side. City were not hanging about, Haaland, Savinho and Jérémy Doku combining to force Luíz Júnior into making his first save after just 26 seconds and the Norwegian heading just wide a little over two minutes later. It was not easy to define the formation Pep Guardiola applied; at times it looked something like 3-2‑4-1, with John Stones stepping in to defence when Villarreal had the ball and out of it when City did. Which is to say that most of the time he was out of it, the shape shifting with him and with others as well. City had 69% of possession in the first half, and the surprise was that it was as low as that: the naked eye suggested even greater dominance. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Manchester City 2 Villarreal 0: Match report from City's win.
arts.sum: Lewis cut the ball back across the penalty area, and Erling Haaland was on hand to fire past Luiz Júnior with his right foot to give Pep Guardiola’s side a well-deserved lead. City surged at the Villarreal defence, and Erling Haaland played a ball wide to Savinho on the right from the edge of the Villarreal penalty area.

arts.ttl: Villarreal 0-2 Manchester City Stats: Haaland Scores Again as City Stroll to Victory
arts.sum: Erling Haaland found the net yet again as Man City won in Spain. Check out the best facts and Opta data in our Villarreal vs Manchester City stats page. The post Villarreal 0-2 Manchester City Stats: Haaland Scores Again as City Stroll to Victory appeared first on Opta Analyst.

arts.ttl: Erling Haaland stretches incredible goal record as Man City cruise past Villarreal
arts.sum: VILLARREAL 0-2 MANCHESTER CITY: Erling Haaland scored in a 12th successive game for club and country before Bernardo Silva sealed all three points for Pep Guardiola's side

arts.ttl: Man City in cruise control: Villarreal brushed aside to make it nine-games unbeaten
arts.sum: Manchester City make it nine-games unbeaten as they brush Villarreal aside on Tuesday night, securing a comfortable 2-0 victory in the Champions League.

arts.ttl: Haaland extends scoring streak as Man City cruise to victory at Villarreal
arts.sum: Manchester City were comfortable 2-0 winners over Villarreal as they registered their first away Champions League win in over a year.

arts.ttl: Villarreal vs. Man City confirmed XIs: Foden, Reijnders benched as Pep makes four changes
arts.sum: Villarreal and Manchester City confirm their starting lineups for tonight’s Champions League clash at Estadio de la Ceramica.
